snippet.title: Contraception as a test of equality
snippet.description: Understanding the role it plays in women's lives.

snippet.title: SIDEBAR: How FDA-approved contraceptive methods work
snippet.description: The Affordable Care Act's contraception mandate specifies women should be offered insurance coverage with no co-payment for all contraceptive methods approved by the Food and Drug Administration.

snippet.title: On the pill for half a century
snippet.description: On May 11, 1960, 50 years ago today, the pharmaceutical company Searle received approval from the Food and Drug Administration to sell a tiny pill named Enovid for birth control. A simple combination of two hormones -- progesterone and estrogen -- the pill inhibited ovulation. If taken correctly,...

snippet.title: Your Views
snippet.description: I hope "Nothing to Get Scared About" [Sept. 1] clarifies living wills for those who shrink away from them. These individuals also need to remember they can change their living will's specifics at any time, including verbally when they are lying in a hospital bed in critical condition. The written...

snippet.title: Health Tip: Choosing a Contraceptive
snippet.description: (HealthDay News) -- Among couples who wish to prevent unwanted pregnancy, there are many contraceptive options available.
